Planning your first adventure in 2025 and looking for a destination that matches your vibes? From sipping champagne in France to cycling the Death Road in Bolivia, let the stars guide your suitcase! Where will you go in 2025? Let the stars decide! As you plan your 2025 Travel, use Expedia to find the best flight and accommodation prices and book your entire trip in one spot! I’ve rounded up all of the best bucket list experiences you have to try this year based on your zodiac sign! Download the Expedia App and check out my Travel Shop to see what the stars have in store for you. PS Expedia Group makes your travel dreams a reality with a unified and expanded loyalty program called One Key, and it’s not just for Expedia. Hotels.com and the vacation rental site, Vrbo, are all part of the fun! When you’re a One Key member, you can earn OneKeyCash for every dollar you spend on eligible hotels, vacation rentals, activities, dreamy packages, car rentals, and even epic cruise adventures.  Traits: Bold, adventurous, and always up for a challenge. Aries loves to take risks and never backs down from an adventure. Aries, it’s time to turn your African travel dreams into reality. Namibia is calling, and trust me, it’s got your name written all over it. With towering sand dunes, the eerie beauty of the Skeleton Coast, and wildlife safaris in Etosha, you’ll be constantly on the go. Whether you’re skydiving over the Namibia Desert or exploring a ghost town, this place will keep your fire burning brightly. Namibia is one of the most nature-filled and beautiful countries in Africa. Namibia is known for its wildlife, open spaces, fauna, and culture. Namibia is a massive country with so much to see and do. Here are three of my top itineraries for Namibia to help you plan an amazing road trip!  ♉︎ Traits: Grounded, indulgent, and with a love for beauty and luxury, Taurus craves the finer things in life. Hawaii is a Taurus dream come true. Picture yourself lounging on a golden beach, surrounded by mountains, and indulging in all the island’s luxury offerings. Expect to be pampered at a spa, explore volcanic craters, or island hop to stunning beaches and hidden coves – this place will satisfy both your love for beauty and relaxation. From hiking to beach cities, this tropical paradise has it all. Here's the ultimate Big Island Hawaii travel guide to help you plan your trip! From the peaks of the volcanoes to the depths of the sea, there’s just so much to explore while island hopping from island of Hawaii to Kauai!  Traits: Inquisitive, adaptable, and always seeking new experiences. Gemini thrives on mental stimulation and enjoys variety. Bolivia is the ultimate playground for a Gemini’s curious spirit. From the mind-blowing Salar de Uyuni salt flats to the vibrant culture of La Paz, there’s always something unexpected waiting around every corner. Bolivia’s mix of adventure, culture, and unique food scene will keep your curious mind engaged, while the stunning landscapes will keep you coming back for more. There really is no other place like Bolivia! Dubbed a country of extremes, it goes from sweltering Amazon lowlands to frozen cold mountain peaks. From the famous Uyuni salt flats to cycling the Death Road, this jam-packed itinerary will show you how to spend two adventurous weeks in Bolivia!  Traits: Nurturing, sentimental, and with a love for comfort and homey vibes. Cancers seek cozy, intimate experiences. England’s calling your name for those cozy, moody moments! Whether you’re sipping tea by a crackling fire in a Cotswold cottage or enjoying a sprawling manor in Sussex, you’ll feel wrapped up in a sense of history and comfort. And let’s not forget the pubs! You’ll find the perfect spot to unwind after exploring quaint villages or getting lost in an English manor, making it the ideal escape for your homebody soul. England is one of the most popular stops in Europe for travelers. It is part of the UK, which includes Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. Ready to create your perfect English itinerary? Here are ten places that you are not going to want to miss (aside from London).  Traits: Bold, confident, and always looking for the spotlight, Leos love destinations that let them shine as brightly as they do. Jordan has the drama and grandeur you crave Leo’s. Petra, with its rose-red stone, is the stuff of legends, and trust me, you’ll want to take the perfect selfie there. Enjoy camel rides through the desert, followed by flavor-packed Middle Eastern dishes. Jordan’s fiery spirit and stunning landscapes promise adventures you’ll be bragging about for years. Jordan was my first-ever trip to the Middle East. I was astounded by the Dead Sea, inspired by the ruins of Petra, and mesmerized by Wadi Rum. There's so much to see in The Rose City of Petra. This ultimate Petra travel guide will help you plan the perfect trip to one of Seven Wonders of the World!  Traits: Practical, organized, and always looking for a deep, meaningful experience, Virgos are drawn to destinations that balance order and beauty. Japan offers the perfect combo of precision and magic for you. The incredible technical innovation in Tokyo will satisfy your love for efficiency, while Kyoto’s temples provide the peace you need to unwind. You’ll appreciate the meticulous order and rich culture that makes up every part of the experience, whether it’s navigating the shinkansen or bar hopping in Golden Gai. Japan’s attention to detail mirrors your own thoughtful nature, and trust me, you’ll find it hard to leave. From temples in Kyoto to street food in Osaka and themed cafes in Tokyo - here's my ultimate Japan travel guide to help you plan your trip! Soak in the traditional Japanese culture, learn about modern life and people watch until your head spins. Here’s my ultimate Tokyo travel guide!  Traits: Aesthetic, social, and always seeking harmony, Libras crave beauty and balance in every aspect of life. If there’s one place that will steal your heart, Libra, it’s Iceland. With its otherworldly landscapes – think glaciers, volcanoes, and waterfalls – you’ll find endless beauty to satisfy your soul. But it’s not all just striking visuals. Iceland offers luxurious experiences too, like the Blue Lagoon, where you can soak in mineral-rich waters under the Northern Lights. A balance of natural wonder and serene luxury? It’s your dream come true. Iceland is the perfect destination for a seasoned travel, a first time solo traveler, or an adventurous family looking to road trip around the island. The Ring Road, Route 1, is the prime Icelandic route, and along with a few essential detours. Here is my 10-Day Iceland Ring Road Itinerary!  Traits: Intense, curious, and deeply passionate, Scorpios love a destination that’s rich in mystery and intrigue. Experience the misty Amazon jungle and the ancient Inca ruins of Machu Picchu, where you’ll be immersed in history and mystery at every turn. The energy of the land feels ancient, and there’s a hidden depth to every experience, from the sacred Valley of the Kings to the enigmatic Nazca Lines – Peru is just as intriguing as you are! Home to Machu Picchu, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Peru is a unique and fascinating country with many different cultural and natural treasures. It took us four days of trekking the Inca Trail to finally reach Machu Picchu. It was one of the most incredible and challenging experiences of my life.  Traits: Adventurous, philosophical, and ever-curious, Sagittarians are drawn to places that challenge them to expand their minds and hearts. Every corner of Sri Lanka has a story to tell, whether you’re shopping in the markets of Colombo, going on safari at Udawalawe National Park, or climbing Pidurangala Rock. Often overlooked by nearby hotspots like the Maldives and India, it’s a must-see off-the-beaten-path destination Your love for deep conversations and fresh experiences will thrive here as you connect with diverse cultures, people, and philosophies. Plus, the sheer range of activities – from spiritual immersion to high-energy adventures – means you’ll never stop exploring. Sri Lanka is called the "Jewel of the Indian Ocean". Home to idyllic beaches, incredible wildlife and a fascinating culture - it's not hard to see why! I spent a week discovering the treasures of the province of North Central Sri Lanka and am sharing my guide to the highlights of the region!  Traits: Ambitious, disciplined, and a lover of luxury, Capricorns know how to appreciate life’s finer things after all their hard work. After all the hustle and grind, Capricorn, it’s time to treat yourself! France offers the kind of refined elegance you can truly enjoy. Whether you’re unwinding in a chalet in the Alps or indulging in delicious wine and cheese in Bordeaux, you’ll appreciate every moment of luxury. But it’s not just about indulgence; France’s cultural history and sophisticated lifestyle will speak to your ambitious side, giving you a well-deserved break in a place that’s both beautiful and inspiring. When it comes to travel in France, Paris sure does dominate the headlines; but the French regions of Provence, Bordeaux and Côte d'Azur are must-sees! As much as I adore Paris, you’ve got to get out of the city to fully appreciate the richness of French culture. Here are 10 incredible places to visit in France!  Traits: Independent, innovative, and always seeking unique experiences, Aquarians crave destinations that are off the beaten path and rich in natural beauty. Aquarius, if there’s a place that matches your thirst for the unusual, it’s The Galapagos Islands. This remote paradise is one of the last untouched places on earth, with landscapes and wildlife you won’t find anywhere else. Your itinerary will feature snorkeling at Tagus Cove, lazing on the beach with some sea lions, spotting Galapagos Giant Tortoises, or hopping aboard a cruise to see all the sights as you sit, back, relax and enjoy the ride. Plus, you’ll love the conservation efforts, which align with your forward-thinking values. The Galapagos Islands are the ultimate destination for adventure lovers. Explore some of the world's most remote islands and their unique biodiversity! The beauty of The Galapagos is that they are miles away from the rest of the world. But, you'll need some help getting to The Galapagos, and around them!  Traits: Dreamy, intuitive, and deeply connected to nature, Pisceans are drawn to magical places that offer both beauty and serenity. Pisces, Australia’s coastal beauty will be your perfect escape. From the sparkling waters of the Whitsundays to the laid-back vibes of the Gold Coast, there’s plenty of natural beauty to explore in the land down under. Choose from diving in the Great Barrier Reef, exploring the vast Outback, or driving the Great Ocean Road – Australia’s dreamlike scenery is just what you need.   Oceania is made up of 14 independent countries, with the most well known being Australia, New Zealand and French Polynesia. While Sydney is incredible, there's so much more to OZ! Here’s a list of ten places in Australia that you should visit. No matter your zodiac sign, 2025 is the perfect year to step out of your comfort zone and explore a destination that matches your unique traits! Let me know in the comments if your travel destination matches your personality or if you have your heart set on another place! I'm often asked for female travel tips and where it's safe for women to travel solo. Here are 10 of the safest destinations for solo female travelers! Not all islands have to be tropical and sun-kissed, but each has their own natural beauty. Here's the best island destinations around the world!

Solo in Madrid? Yes, please 🇪🇸✨••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••If you’re dreaming of a city that’s beautiful, welcoming, safe, and made for wandering at your own pace — Madrid belongs at the top of your list.From terrace-hopping with tapas and vermouth, to slow mornings in El Retiro, sunset views by the Royal Palace, world-class museums, flamenco nights, rooftop bars, and neighborhoods full of local energy… Madrid is the ultimate choose-your-own-adventure for solo female travelers.I put together a complete solo travel guide to Madrid with:• Where to stay (from luxe icons to new openings)• Local experiences you shouldn’t miss• The best neighborhoods for food, culture & shopping• Sunset spots, rooftops & live music• Tips to feel confident and at home while exploring solo👇👇👇Comment “GUIDE” and I’ll send you the full blog post with everything you need to plan your trip.••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••#VisitMadrid #MadridTravel #SoloFemaleTravel #SpainTravel #MadridGuide

The Blonde Abroad Popular travel and lifestyle blog featuring travel tips, fashion, food and photography from around the world. Follow Kiersten on her adventures!  Ever thought about taking a little adventure just for you? The kind where you wander a new city at your own pace, meet amazing locals, and soak up a culture that’s completely different from home? If you’re craving a destination with history, AMAZING food, gorgeous architecture — and one that feels super safe for solo travelers — then it’s time to put Madrid on your radar. With delicious food, affordable living, and deluxe shopping, the capital of Spain deserves its own spotlight of fame. Check out all of my tips in the ultimate Madrid travel guide! After studying abroad in Spain, I could still spend years exploring. From Madrid to Barcelona to Girona to Bilbao, it’s such a vibrant country. Madrid makes it almost impossible to choose where to stay…in the best way. You’ve got everything from luxe five-star hideaways to boutique gems and hotels with rooftop pools. Wherever you check in, you’ll feel right at home and instantly welcomed. Many hotels also offer those extra touches that make a trip feel special: think beautiful spas, great restaurants, and super unique interiors. If you’re looking for places to stay, here are my top recommendations. New openings worth checking out: Iconic Madrid favorites: Madrid is one of the most sociable cities you’ll ever visit, and you feel it instantly. The vibe is warm, lively, and so easy to slip into. Make sure to add these local experiences to your itinerary to really make the most of it. Do what the locals do: grab a seat at a terraza (aka a restaurant in the open air), order some tapas or a glass of wine, and just enjoy the moment. “Terraceo”, or moving from terraza to terraza, is all about hopping between outdoor tables, sharing plates, and people-watching. “Tardeo” is its early-evening cousin, relaxed, fun, and perfect if you don’t want a late night. For a classic Madrid moment, wander through the huge El Retiro Park (it’s 125 hectares!). For a bit of fun, jump in one of the multicolored boats to row around the lake. If you’re in town on a Sunday, head to Plaza de Cascorro in the central neighborhood of La Latina to explore El Rastro. It’s full of stalls selling vintage finds, clothing, accessories, and handmade goods for all ages. End your visit with a customary aperitivo in the area’s bars and tabernas, pairing a glass of wine, beer, or vermouth on tap with tapas like some paella or cod fritters. And yep, this tradition goes all the way back to the 18th century, so it’s hard to say no to! Need a little extra guidance while you’re in Madrid? Stop by one of the city’s tourist information centers — the Plaza Mayor Information Centre is open year-round. You can also use the virtual tourist video assistance service if you prefer quick, on-the-go answers. Madrid is a dream for foodies, especially if you enjoy wandering around, sharing plates, and discovering places locals actually love. I highly recommend taking a tapas tour to find the best authentic spots and to learn more about the food, culture, and history. Start in neighborhoods like Madrid de los Austrias (Habsburg Madrid), La Latina, and Barrio de las Letras (Literary Quarter). These central pockets are full of traditional tapas bars and give you that classic Madrid food experience without having to go too far. If you want to step off the tourist path, try Chueca, Malasaña, Conde Duque, or Lavapiés. Each neighborhood has its own vibe, from trendy and creative to international and eclectic, and they’re all packed with great, casual spots full of Madrileños. Near El Retiro, Boulevard de Ibiza is lined with bars and terrazas that locals adore. And Calle de Ponzano in Chamberí is one of the city’s trendiest foodie streets, perfect for hopping between bars all afternoon or evening. I went to Madrid for the third time recently, and was really excited to do so. Here are my top picks of places for the best food in Madrid! Did you know that the third Thursday of June is World Tapas Day? I'm all for getting festive, so naturally, the only way to celebrate is by tasting all the tapas! Traveling solo in Madrid is a dream if you love culture, as there’s always something to see, explore, or stumble upon. The city is packed with museums, galleries, historic landmarks, and creative spaces that make simply wandering feel like an adventure in itself. Begin at Paseo del Prado and El Retiro Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This area is home to Madrid’s “big three” museums: You’ll also find beautiful spots like the Royal Botanical Gardens, the Royal Spanish Language Academy, the National Museum of Decorative Arts, and even the Royal Astronomical Observatory. Madrid is full of charming, lesser-known museums that are perfect for a quieter morning or afternoon. Don’t miss the Sorolla Museum, the Lázaro Galdiano Museum, the Lope de Vega house-museum, or the Museum of Romanticism. If you’re into contemporary art and design, places like Matadero Madrid, Casa Encendida, and Conde Duque offer exhibitions, performances, and installations. You’ll also find plenty of independent galleries, especially around the Reina Sofía museum. For something fun in the evening, see a musical along the Gran Vía — Madrid’s version of Broadway. If opera is more your style, Teatro Real is one of the world’s top opera houses and absolutely worth experiencing. Whether you are staying in the city for a short weekend or a couple of weeks, here are the top seven things to see and do in Madrid! Renting a bike is such a fun way to see a different side of Madrid.  Start with Madrid Río Park, a long stretch of riverside paths and gardens that used to have a city motorway running through it, but is now a calm, green space perfect for cycling. It’s an easy, scenic ride and feels worlds away from the busy streets. If you want even more nature, head to Casa de Campo, the city’s largest public park. You can ride for miles here, stop at a terraza by the amazing artificial lake (that dates back to the 16th century!), or even take out one of the rowboats for a moment on the water. Spain is made up of multiple regions, and they all offer female travelers something different. Food, culture and beaches are all available in Spain! Madrid is firmly on the list of Spain’s best travel destinations, especially if you love shopping! And don’t just stick to the name brands, Madrid has plenty of independent shops where you can find truly unique pieces. If you love bringing home souvenirs that feel personal and tied to the place, you’ll have plenty to choose from — capes, handcrafted fans, ceramics, jewelry, handbags, tapestries, violet sweets, even traditional Spanish guitars. For the best mix of old and new, explore neighborhoods like: As you wander, you’ll come across century-old institutions like Capas Seseña, Sombrerería Medrano, and Guitarras Ramírez, as well as contemporary studios such as Andrés Gallardo with his distinctive jewelry pieces, and Javier Medina, known for his “ecological trophies” crafted from bamboo. Make the most of your Madrid layover with my shopping guide. Discover luxe boutiques and local gems to refresh your wardrobe for Europe. Madrid has a way of slowing you down in all the right ways, especially at sunset. It’s the perfect time to take a breath, soak in the moment, and enjoy some of the city’s most magical viewpoints. For dreamy golden-hour views, head to spots like Las Vistillas Gardens or the Mirador de la Cornisa by the Royal Palace. Another favorite is the area around Oeste Park, home to the Temple of Debod, an ancient Egyptian monument that gives sunset a little extra mystery. As you guys might have noticed, I absolutely adore Spain. Here are my tips for the best time to go to Spain and experience the beautiful country! If you want a fun night out in Madrid, book a spot somewhere that mixes great food with great music. There are plenty of places that pair set menus with live performances, like Aurora, Bule Bule, and Fanático, all known for their lively atmosphere and creative dining rooms. If flamenco is on your list (and it absolutely should be!), check out the program at Corral de la Morería. It’s one of the most iconic flamenco venues in the world and even offers Michelin-star dining. Tablao de la Villa and Las Carboneras are also fantastic options, combining incredible flamenco shows with classic Spanish dishes. Ready to say hola to one of Europe’s greatest destinations? Here are my favorite ten places to visit in Spain (that aren’t Barcelona). To end your day on a high note, head up to one of Madrid’s many rooftop bars or restaurants. The city does rooftop culture incredibly well, with skyline views that feel even prettier after sunset. Some favorites to bookmark include: So, have I sold you on Madrid yet?! With more direct flights to Madrid from U.S. hubs than ever before, the city is fast becoming one of the best cities in Europe to visit. Madrid weather is pleasantly mild in spring and fall — perfect for sightseeing without blistering heat — allowing you to wander its grand boulevards and sunny plazas in total comfort. And whether you’re strolling through the Royal Palace or catching a live flamenco show, all the best things to do in Madrid deliver on both culture and fun. I think you will fall in love with the heart of Spain as much as I did! Ready to see the world? Do it on your own time line! For the ultimate solo trip, travel alone in one of these amazing cities!
